maml:description.maml:para: Active Directory supplemental asset connector. Returns data for TeamDynamix.

Supplemental connectors add supplemental data to collections produced by primary connectors. This is the Active Directory supplemental asset connector. It retrieves data from Active Directory and adds it as a property to a collection produced by a primary connector. Reads information from Configuration.psd1 to determine how to retrieve the data and how to format it. Use variable name "ConnectorQuery" to create options for querying the ActiveDirectory in the config file.
Asset data to be supplemented.
Connector information.
Name to use for Active Directory lookup, if not the name of the asset.
Return raw data

maml:description.maml:para: Get directory information on people at OSU.

Get directory information about people at OSU using the OSU master directory for faculty, staff, and students. Uses web interface to OSU's public FindPeople system or the REST API to the private PeopleAPI system (requires credentials and may only be accessed from the campus network).
Name of individual(s) to look up in FindPeople. Must be of the form 'name.n', 'lastname' or 'firstname lastname'.

Properties of the record to return and show. By default, all properties are returned, but only SearchName, Username, Name, and Affiliation are shown. If specific properties are requested, only the default properties and the requested properties are returned and displayed.
Provided for compatibility with TeamDynamix data connectors
Name.n of individual(s) to look up in the PeopleAPI. Must be of the form "Name.N".
Credential to use to authenticate to the PeopleAPI REST API.

Properties of the record to return and show. By default, all properties are returned, but only SearchName, Username, Name, and Affiliation are shown. If specific properties are requested, only the default properties and the requested properties are returned and displayed.
Provided for compatibility with TeamDynamix data connectors
Name of individual(s) to look up in FindPeople. Must be of the form 'name.n', 'lastname' or 'firstname lastname'.
Name.n of individual(s) to look up in the PeopleAPI. Must be of the form "Name.N".

Provided for compatibility with TeamDynamix data connectors

BuildingNumber - <string> The person's building's ID number
VP_CollegeName - <string> The person's VP or college name
SearchName - <string> The name used in the search

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about TeamDynamix assets that may be inconsistent.

OSU-specific function. Convenience function to obtain information about TeamDynamix assets that may be inconsistent. Such as assets with duplicate names or serial numbers, assets with no serial number, or assets whose 'Three and Green in 2018' information is not complete but the asset is marked as complete. By default, return all consistency information.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Return assets whose serial number is blank.
Return assets with duplicate serial numbers.
Return assets with duplicate names. May be slow to process.
Return assets with duplicate MAC addresses. Slow to process.
Return assets with incomplete TaG18 information, but where the asset is marked as complete. Slow to process.
Return assets whose serial number is blank.
Return assets with duplicate serial numbers.
Return assets with duplicate names. May be slow to process.
Return assets with duplicate MAC addresses. Slow to process.
Return assets with incomplete TaG18 information, but where the asset is marked as complete. Slow to process.

Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all available consistency information.
Returns assets whose serial number is blank.
Returns assets whose serial number is blank, as well as assets with duplicate names. Then, outputs a list of the names that are duplicated.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $TaG18 = Get-TDAssetConsistency -TaG18 $TaG18.TaG18Inconsistent.NotEncrypted | Format-Table ID, Name, @{e={$_.Attributes.Where{$_.Name -eq 'Encryption Status'}.ValueText};n='Encryption Status'} -AutoSize

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns TaG18 inconsistencies for all assets flagged as TaG18 Complete, but are not encrypted, then formats the result as a table with columns for ID, Name, and Encryption Status.

maml:description.maml:para: Get blackout windows from TeamDynamix

maml:description.maml:para: Get ticket activity for tickets open during a specified time period.

Get ticket activity for tickets open during a specified time period. Organized by requesting unit, ASCTech group, or by ASCTech employee. Specify which sections of the report are desired: ticket counts, recent activity, or all activity on tickets open during the specified time period.
The name.n of technicians whose activity is desired. Specify as "name.n".
The name.n of clients whose activity is desired. Specify as "name.n".

The number of days to look back for the report data. If the first day is a weekend, the report will back up to the previous Friday. The default is one day, so if run on a Monday, it will include the previous business day (Friday) automatically. Alternative: -ReportFrom.

The sections of the report to include. Sections are "Ticket Counts", which are counts of open/closed tickets, as well as closure rates for units and groups; "Recent activity", which includes all updates that occurred within the reporting period; and "Historical activity", which lists all updates that occurred for tickets that were open during the reporting period. The default is "All".
Creates a special section for tickets not updated during the reporting period.
The filename for the report. The default is "C:\Temp\(user|group|unit).html".
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Name of support group(s)
Name of unit(s)
The name.n of technicians whose activity is desired. Specify as "name.n".
The name.n of clients whose activity is desired. Specify as "name.n".
The date and time to start the reporting period. Alternative: -ReportInterval.
The date and time to end the reporting period. Optional, defaults to current date and time.

The sections of the report to include. Sections are "Ticket Counts", which are counts of open/closed tickets, as well as closure rates for units and groups; "Recent activity", which includes all updates that occurred within the reporting period; and "Historical activity", which lists all updates that occurred for tickets that were open during the reporting period. The default is "All".
Creates a special section for tickets not updated during the reporting period.
The filename for the report. The default is "C:\Temp\(user|group|unit).html".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ExceptionFiledID = (Get-TDCustomAttribute -ComponentID Asset | Where-Object Name -eq 'Exception Filed').ID $ExceptionFiledYesID = ((Get-TDCustomAttribute -ComponentID Asset | Where-Object Name -eq 'Exception Filed').Choices | Where-Object Name -eq 'Yes').ID Get-TDProductModel -ID 5504 -Attributes @($ExceptionFiledID,$ExceptionFiledYesID)

Switch. For reports retrieved by ID, include the report data.
Optional sorting expression to use for the report's data. Default is to use the sort specified in the report.

maml:description.maml:para: Get ticket activity counts for tickets opened during a specified time period.

Get ticket activity counts for tickets opened during a specified time period. Also provides comparison data from an earlier time period. Can return a formatted report or just the raw data. The formatted report includes counts of tickets opened during the report time period, closed during the report time period, a count of tickets that were both opened and closed during the report time period, as well as a count of tickets opened during the comparison time period. It also includes a breakdown of tickets opened/closed by support unit during the report time period.
Use a GUI date picker to specify the dates for the report and comparison.

Do not produce a pretty-formatted report. Only returns the raw data, including the start and end dates of the report time period, the start of the comparison time period, and all tickets opened or closed in the report time period, as well as all tickets opened in the comparison time period.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
The start date for the report time period. Default is the previous weekday.
The number of days from the start date to include in the report time period. The default is one day.
The start date for the comparison time period. The default is one week before StartDate. The comparison time period will be the same number of days as the report time period.

Do not produce a pretty-formatted report. Only returns the raw data, including the start and end dates of the report time period, the start of the comparison time period, and all tickets opened or closed in the report time period, as well as all tickets opened in the comparison time period.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.

Use a GUI date picker to specify the dates for the report and comparison.
The start date for the report time period. Default is the previous weekday.
The number of days from the start date to include in the report time period. The default is one day.
The start date for the comparison time period. The default is one week before StartDate. The comparison time period will be the same number of days as the report time period.

Do not produce a pretty-formatted report. Only returns the raw data, including the start and end dates of the report time period, the start of the comparison time period, and all tickets opened or closed in the report time period, as well as all tickets opened in the comparison time period.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a formatted text report with counts of tickets opened/closed during the previous day, as well as a count of tickets opened a week ago.

Use a GUI date picker to select the start date, end date, and comparison date for a formatted text report with counts of tickets opened/closed during the selected interval, as well as a count of tickets opened on the date selected.
Returns raw data listing tickets opened/closed during the previous day, as well as tickets opened a week ago.
Produces a formatted text report with counts of tickets opened/closed on October 1, 2020, as well as a count of tickets opened on September 22, 2020.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a time entry in TeamDynamix.

Get a time entry in TeamDynamix. Specify the time entry ID number or search using the minutes, date, rate, type, workspace, plan, task, ticket, application, status, person, component, time off, billability, or if it is limited. Results will only include time for the current user unless the current user has the Analysis application or is an organization's Web API User.
The time entry ID to return.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
The minimum number of minutes a time entry can have to be returned. Can be negative. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The maximum number of minutes a time entry can have to be returned. Can be negative. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The minimum date the time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The maximum date the time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The minimum date the time entry can have been created by to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The maximum date the time entry can have been created by to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.

The minimum status date the time entry can have to be returned. Status date is updated when a time entry is submitted, approved, rejected, etc. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.

The maximum status date the time entry can have to be returned. Status date is updated when a time entry is submitted, approved, rejected, etc. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The minimum billable rate a time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The maximum billable rate a time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The minimum cost rate a time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The maximum cost rate a time entry can have to be returned. Optional. When omitted or null this is not used for filtering.
The list of time type identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of project, request, or workspace identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of plan identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of task identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of issue identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of ticket identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of ticket task identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.

The list of application identifiers, typically used with ticketing applications. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of status identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
The list of person unique identifiers. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.

The list of components, allowing results to be focused down to tickets, issues, etc. If this is empty or null, no filtering will occur, otherwise, only items that use one of the specfified time types will be returned.
A value indicating whether only time off entries (true), only non-time off entries (false), or all entries should be returned. Defaults to all entries.
A value indicating whether only billable entries (true), only non-billable entries (false), or all entries should be returned. Defaults to all entries.
A value indicating whether only limited entries (true), only non-limited entries (false), or all entries should be returned. Defaults to all entries.
The maximum number of results to be returned. Defaults to 1000.
Include full detail for time entries
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a user account from TeamDynamix

Gets a specific user, or searches for matching users, from TeamDynamix. Search by UID or use the -filter option to match on a substring from: Full name Username (for TeamDynamix users) External ID Alternate ID Searching by UID returns full detail on the account. Searching with Filter returns less detail on the account. Use the -IsEmployee and -IsActive options to restrict results to employees and active user acounts. Use the -Fast switch to return minimal account detail on up to 100 accounts at a time (default 50). Much faster for multiple queries.
UID of the user to be retrieved. Returns full account detail. Available on the pipeline.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Substring search filter, or leave blank for all accounts. Returns limited account detail.
Return users with the exactly specified username. No partial matches.
Return full detail for user.
Return exact match for SearchText in users. Searches AlertEmail, AlternateEmail, AuthenticationUsername, PrimaryEmail, FullName, and UserName.
Boolean to limit return set to active users ($true), or inactive users ($false), or all users ($null). Default is active users.
Boolean to limit return set to users flagged as confidential ($true) or not confidential ($false), or all users ($null). Default is non-confidential users.
Boolean to limit return set to employees ($true), or non-employees ($false).

Return users holding one of the specified reference IDs.

Return users with the specified alternate ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Create new ASC user in TeamDynamix

Ticket type ID.
Ticket impact ID.
Ticket urgency ID.
Date ticket goes off hold.
Estimated minutes to completion of the ticket.
Ticket start date.
Ticket end date.
UID of person responsible for ticket.
UID of group responsible for ticket.
Time budget for ticket.
Expenses budget for ticket.
Ticket title.
ID of building for ticket.
ID of room for ticket.
Location name for ticket.
Room name for ticket.
ID of associated service.
Custom attributes.
Boolean to determine if the responsible resource is notified of the ticket. $true indicates they will be notified, $false indicates no notification. Default is no notification.
Boolean to determine if the reviewer is notified of the ticket. $true indicates they will be notified, $false indicates no notification. Default is no notification.
Boolean to determine if the requestor is notified of the ticket. $true indicates they will be notified, $false indicates no notification. Default is no notification.

Boolean to determine if the requestor should be created if an existing person with matching information cannot be found. $true indicates they will be created, $false indicates they will not be created. Default is no creation.
Department ID assigned to the ticket.
Application ID for the ticketing app.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Ticket status ID.
Ticket priority ID.
ID of ticket requestor.
Form type ID. Use "0" to apply the default form for the classification.
Ticket description.
Ticket source ID.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Name of application
Name of ticket form
Name of ticket impact
Name of ticket priority

Name of ticket source
Name of ticket status
Name of ticket type
Name of ticket urgency
ID of associated service offering.

Boolean to determine if the requestor is notified of the ticket. $true indicates they will be notified, $false indicates no notification. Default is no notification.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new ticket status in TeamDynamix
Creates a new ticket status in TeamDynamix.
Name of the ticket status.
Description of ticket status.
The order of the ticket status when displayed in a list (default 1.0).
Set whether ticket status is active or not. Default: true.
Set whether ticket requires a Goes Off Hold value. Only applicable when ticket status class is OnHold. Default: true.

Set whether ticket is exempt from automatically updating based on the Reopening Completed/Cancelled Ticket Options or the Completed Ticket Options ticket application settings. Only applicable when the ticket status class is Completed or Cancelled. Default: true.
Status class name of the ticket status.
Application ID for the ticketing application.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Name of the ticket status.
Description of ticket status.
The order of the ticket status when displayed in a list (default 1.0).
Set whether ticket status is active or not. Default: true.
Status class name of the ticket status.
Set whether ticket requires a Goes Off Hold value. Only applicable when ticket status class is OnHold. Default: true.

Set whether ticket is exempt from automatically updating based on the Reopening Completed/Cancelled Ticket Options or the Completed Ticket Options ticket application settings. Only applicable when the ticket status class is Completed or Cancelled. Default: true.
Application ID for the ticketing application.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Description of ticket task.
Start date of ticket task.
End date of ticket task.
Expected duration of task, in minutes. Value is in operational minutes, so operational hours, weekends, and days off are all taken into account.

ID of the group responsible for the task.
ID of the predecessor for the task.
Type of ticket task. Types include: regular task, scheduled maintenance, workflow, or other. Default is regular task.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new user account in TeamDynamix

Create a new user account in TeamDynamix. Accepts information about the new user via pipeline or commandline. If user already exists and account is active, no action is taken. If user already exists and account is inactive, account is reactivated and updated with any additional information supplied.
Username of the new user account.
Security role (specified by ID number) for user account.
Applications list for user account.
New organizationally-defined applications for user account. Use New-TDUserApplication to create the individual applications. For more than one, specify as an array.
Client portal application for user account. Leave blank to use the default.
Department (also known as "account", specified by ID number) for user account.
List of groups (specified by ID number) for user account.
Company name for user account. Required.
Title for user account.
Work phone number for user account.
Primary phone location (work, home, mobile, etc...) for user account.
Password for user account. Required.
Work address for user account.
Work city for user account.
Work state for user account.
Work zip for user account.
Location (building) ID for user account.
Room ID for user account.
Employee status for user account.
User type
Specify whether the user is active or not. Default is active.
Specify whether the user is confidential or not. Default is not confidential.
First name for user account. Required.
New custom attributes for user account. Replaces existing custom attributes. Specify as an array.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Middle name for user account.
Last name for user account. Required.
Primary email address for user account. Required.
Alert email address for user acccount. Required.
Alternate email address for user account.
Employee ID (alternate ID) for user account.
Return newly created user object.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The "About Me" information associated with the user.
The ID of the authentication provider the new user will use for authentication.
The authentication username of the user, used for authenticating with non-TeamDynamix authentication types.
The cost rate of the user.
The ID of the default priority associated with the user.
The default bill rate of the user.
The date after which the user is no longer available for scheduling and no longer required to log time.
The organizational ID of the user.
The fax number of the user.
The home address of the user.
The home city of the user.
The home country of the user.
The home phone number of the user.
The home state abbreviation of the user.
The home zip code of the user.
The Instant Messenger (IM) username/handle associated with the user.
The Instant Messenger (IM) provider associated with the user.
Whether the user's capacity is managed, meaning they can have capacity and will appear on capacity/availability reports.
The mobile phone number of the user.
The nickname of the user.
The other phone number of the user.
The pager number of the user.
The UID of the person who the user reports to.
The date after which the user should start reporting time. This also governs capacity calculations.
The ID of the resource pool associated with the user.
The salutation of the user.
Whether the user should report time.
The ID of the time zone associated with the user.
The number of workable hours in a work day for the user.
The work country of the user.

dev:type.maml:name: Settings may be passed down the pipeline by name.
Powershell object containing user account properties as documented in

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ApplicationList = @('MyWork','TDAssets','TDChat','TDCommunity','TDKnowledgeBase','TDNews','TDNext','TDPeople','TDQuestions','TDRequests','TDTicketRequests','TDTickets') $SecurityRoleIDTechnician = 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX' $TicketsApp = New-TDUserApplication -SecurityRoleID XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX -IsAdministrator $true $AssetCIApp = New-TDUserApplication -SecurityRoleID XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX -IsAdministrator $true 'user1','user2','user3','user4' | ConvertFrom-ADtoTDUser -ADDomainName $ADDomainName -ADCredentials $ADCredential | New-TDUser -SecurityRoleID $SecurityRoleIDTechnician -Applications $ApplicationList -OrgApplications @($TicketsApp,$AssetCIApp)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Takes user1, user2, user3, and user 4, looks them up in the AD, converts their information to TD format, then creates new technician accounts on TeamDynamix, with the desired list of applications and org applications.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a user application object locally for use with TeamDynamix.
Create a local user application object. This is used when creating or modifying user OrgApplications in TeamDynamix. This does not create an object on TeamDynamix.
The ID of the specific security role that the user has within the application.
Gets whether the user is marked as an administrator of the application. Default is false.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
The ID of the specific security role that the user has within the application.
Gets whether the user is marked as an administrator of the application. Default is false.
Hashtable with one key: "Authorization" and value of "Bearer" followed by the JSON bearer web token. See Set-TDAuthentication.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns an object for the specified security role, not an administrator for the application, suitable for use with New-TDUser or Set-TDUser's OrgApplication parameter.
Returns an object for the specified security role, as an administrator for the application, suitable for use with New-TDUser or Set-TDUser's OrgApplication parameter.
Creates a user application object and adds that application to the specified user.

maml:description.maml:para: Fix errors on assets related to erased data
Uses the asset feed to find data that was erased from the asset record (set to "Nothing") and restore it. Use cautiously and test on the sandbox site first to ensure proper results.
Feed entry object
Feed entry object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ChangedAssets = Get-TDAsset | Where-Object ModifiedDate -gt 11-1-2018 $ChangedAssets.ID | ForEach-Object {Get-TDAssetFeed -ID $_ | Select-Object -First 1} | Restore-TDAssetErasedDataError | Set-TDAsset

maml:description.maml:para: Modify an asset or assets in TeamDynamix

Modify properties of a single asset or process bulk asset updates in TeamDynamix. Bulk updates handle up to 1,000 assets at a time. For bulk updates, use the CreateItems and UpdateItems parameters to specify if updates should create new items as necessary and/or update existing items. By default, both CreateItems and UpdateItems are set to create and/or update as necessary.

maml:description.maml:para: Authenticate with TeamDynamix

Authenticate with TeamDynamix using BEID or username. Sets the credentials for other commands to use, unless the NoUpdate option is set. If NoUpdate Passthru is set, returns site selection (production, sandbox, or preview), and a hashtable suitable for use in the header of an Invoke-RESTMethod call. Alias: Update-TDAuthentication.
Use PowerShell credential object (Get-Credential) for authentication.
Does not update credentials for the module and returns credentials to the command line.
Return authentication and site information, even if NoUpdate switch is not used.
Execute the commands on the specified TeamDynamix site. Valid options are "Production", "Sandbox", and "Preview". Default is the site selected when the module was loaded.
Does not clear cached TeamDynamix data.

correctly for use as a header in an Invoke-RESTMethod call to

dev:remarks.maml:para: Renews the authentication for the current PowerShell session. Useful when leaving a window open for more than 24 hours, which is the lifetime of an authentication. Clears cached TeamDynamix data.
Creates an alternate TeamDynamix authentication that can be used for all commands, without changing the default authentication. Useful when testing as a different user.
Creates a file containing credentials which are retrieved later to renew the authentication for the current PowerShell session. Clears cached TeamDynamix data.
Renews the authentication for the current PowerShell session using credentials obtained from the vault created by the Mirosoft.PowerShell.SecretManagement module. Preserves cached TeamDynamix data.
Authenticates using supplied credentials, and returns a list of user accounts on the system. Clears cached TeamDynamix data.
Authenticates using supplied credentials, updates the authentication information for other commands to use and returns a list of user accounts on the system. Clears cached TeamDynamix data.

maml:description.maml:para: Perform bulk user updates in TeamDynamix.

Perform bulk user updates in TeamDynamix. Update users' desktop template list, accounts (departments), active status, applications list, org applications list, security role, or group memberships. Note that these updates can only be made once every 2 minutes, so be sure to collect the updates together. Only one type of update may be performed at any given time.

maml:description.maml:para: Set a time entry in TeamDynamix.

Modify an existing time entry in TeamDynamix. If the time entry is on a ticket, specify the application ID and ticket ID. If the time entry is on an issue, task, or project, specify the project. If the time entry is on an issue or task, specify the plan ID.
The ID of the time entry. This should be zero or negative when performing an add.
The ID of the item the time entry is entered against.
The unique identifier of the user who created the time entry.
The ID of the associated time type.
The ID of the associated application. This should be zero except when working with ticketing applications.
The type of module the ItemID corresponds with.
The ticket identifier. This is useful if the time entry is on a ticket or ticket task. Note that Component, AppID, and ItemID should still be set.
The minutes logged for the time entry.
The description of the time entry.
The date the time entry should be recorded for.

maml:description.maml:para: Update all ASC assets in TeamDynamix

OSU-specific function. Convenience function to update all ASC assets in TeamDynamix. Runs the Update-TDAsset function for all assets in ASC. Draws data from SCCM, Jamf, and Satellite servers. Requires SCCM admin console to be installed locally. Takes several hours to complete.

Runs the Update-TDAssets function to update all ASC assets in TeamDynamix. Credentials are loaded from the file U:Credential.xml. Uses default URLs and APIs/queries for Satellite, and Puppet. Uses custom API and console URL for Jamf. Uses custom query for SCCM.

Runs the Update-TDAssets function to update all ASC assets in TeamDynamix. User is prompted for credentials. Uses default URLs and APIs/queries for SCCM, Jamf and Puppet. Uses custom console URL for Satellite, specifying two servers.

Runs the Update-TDAssets function to update all ASC assets in TeamDynamix. Results are passed through to the console. User is prompted for credentials. Uses default URLs and APIs/queries.

Data to be used to update TeamDynamix assets.
Input data from Template. Used for updating data from the field. Expects CSV file with column headers to match names of TeamDynamix asset attributes or custom attributes.
Override the name check on a template import. Do not check if the name matches the serial number. Overwrites the name of the asset if the template has a different name.

Override the serial number check on a template import. Do not check if the serial number matches the name. Overwrites the serial number of the asset if the template has a different serial number. Use with extreme caution because the serial number is used as an index by automated asset update processes. Overriding the serial number check can result in overwriting the wrong asset, particularly when names are duplicated.

Accept bad serial numbers, such as blanks, in template import data. Use with caution because the serial number is used as an index by automated asset update processes. Creating an asset with a bad serial number creates an asset whose serial number is not usable as an index and cannot be managed by the automated asset update processes.
Review CSV columns to see which are valid for template import.

Update user automated group memberships in TeamDynamix

OSU-specific function. Convenience function to update user automated group memberships in TeamDynamix. Currently manages groups based on building where office is based on text from the work address.Accepts username and work address via the pipeline.Suitable for use with output from ConvertFrom-ADtoTDUser.
TeamDynamix username (should end in @osu.edu)
User's work address. May contain the user's building name
